title: 114_s1005
content: The "Health Coverage Tax Credit Extension Act of 2015" extends and modifies the Health Coverage Tax Credit. The "Health Coverage Tax Credit Extension Act of 2015" extends the Health Coverage Tax Credit until January 1, 2020. It also allows taxpayers to elect for coverage under a qualified health plan. The Health Coverage Tax Credit Extension Act of 2015 extends the credit until January 1, 2020. Taxpayers can elect coverage for eligible months in a taxable year, which is irrevocable once made. This election does not count as a coverage month for the premium tax credit. The Health Coverage Tax Credit Extension Act of 2015 extends the credit until January 1, 2020. Taxpayers can elect coverage for eligible months in a taxable year, which is irrevocable once made. The tax imposed for the taxable year may be increased by excess advance payments made on behalf of the taxpayer under the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act. Section 7527 credits allowed without regard to section 36B for the taxable year. The Health Coverage Tax Credit Extension Act of 2015 extends the credit until January 1, 2020. Section 7527 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to extend the advance payment program by one year after the enactment of the Act. The Health Coverage Tax Credit Extension Act of 2015 extends the credit until January 1, 2020. Section 7527 of the Internal Revenue Code is amended to extend the advance payment program by one year after the enactment of the Act. Individual insurance is treated as qualified health insurance without regard to enrollment date. The Internal Revenue Code is amended to exclude insurance coverage through an Exchange under the Affordable Care Act. Amendments apply to taxable years starting after December 31, 2013, with a transition rule for coverage months after December 31, 2015. The Internal Revenue Code of 2015 includes a transition rule allowing an election to apply section 35 to eligible coverage months in taxable years after December 31, 2013, and before the enactment date. The election can be made before the 3-year limitation period expires and can be done on an amended return. After the enactment of the Act, government agencies will conduct outreach programs to inform eligible individuals about the extension of the tax credit under section 35 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. This includes retroactive claims for coverage months starting after December 31, 2013.
